properties.areaDesc: South Mountain/Ahwatukee; North Phoenix/Glendale; Buckeye/Avondale; East Valley; Northwest Valley; Central Phoenix; Deer Valley; Southeast Valley/Queen Creek; Scottsdale/Paradise Valley
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 2:20AM MST until February 5 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the first Freeze Watch, temperatures in the lower 30s
possible. For the second Freeze Watch, temperatures in the upper
20s to the lower 30s possible.

* WHERE...The Northwest Valley of the Phoenix Metro Area,
Buckeye/Avondale, Deer Valley, Central Phoenix, North
Phoenix/Glendale, Scottsdale/Paradise Valley, The East Valley
of the Phoenix Metro Area, South Mountain/Ahwatukee and
Southeast Valley/Queen Creek.

* WHEN...For the first Freeze Watch, from late Monday night
through Tuesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from
Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
